text: Older Americans have the fundamental right to: Preserved and improved Social Security benefits Protection against financial exploitation and digital identity theft Protection against age discrimination in the workforce #ProtectOlderAmericans
The men and women who carried Operation Desert Storm helped bring an end to the Gulf War. Their service and sacrifice should be honored and remembered.

I'm excited to announce I'm accepting submissions for the 2020 Congressional Art Competition from now until Friday, April 17th! Check out my website for more information on eligibility and how to participate:

SCAM ALERT: There have been reports of scam calls in our area from someone pretending to be a representative from PG&E – making threats to shut off customers’ power if they do not make a payment. PG&E has confirmed that this is a scam.

Great to join @pewtrusts for a conversation with state leaders on bridging gaps in broadband access and adoption. It’s critical that policymakers at the federal level partner with states and local communities to find solutions.

Opening the entire 6 GHz band for unlicensed use would foster innovation and greatly benefit American consumers and our nation's economy. Today I sent a letter with @RepMGriffith to @AjitPaiFCC urging the Chairman to do just that.

Today I’m voting for #KeepItWild legislation to protect 1.3 million acres of wilderness. This important bill is just another example of how @HouseDemocrats are fighting the #ClimateCrisis and protecting our #PublicLands.
It’s time to end political interference with women’s private medical decisions. It’s time for the Women’s Health Protection Act #WHPA.

More backward logic from the Trump Administration: While our nation faces a looming climate crisis, the #TrumpBudget proposes to slash EPA funding by 26.5%, cut DOE Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy funding by 74%, & eliminate the Advanced Research Projects Agency.
While corporate profits are soaring, most Americans are working too hard for too little. The #PROAct strengthens workers’ power to organize and negotiate for a fair share of the profits they produce.

Help make sure everyone in our community is counted in #Census2020. The @USCensusBureau is hiring in our district and across the country. Learn more or apply today at: https://recruitment.2020census.gov/
#CitizensUnited opened a floodgate of corporate spending in politics and caused a wave of dark money to wash over our elections, drowning out the voices of the American people.
This is a sad day for our nation. With this vote, Senate Republicans have signed off on foreign interference in our elections.
Protecting people with pre-existing conditions is something we can all agree on. At tonight’s #SOTU, I want to hear how we can work together to improve the #StateOfHealthCare #ForThePeople.
Don’t forget, today is the last day for Californians to sign-up for health insurance through @CoveredCA.

The Trump Administration is trying to throw people off the #SocialSecurity rolls with their proposed rule for disability insurance. Americans EARN these benefits! That’s why I joined 100+ of my colleagues calling on them to halt this disastrous proposal! #NoSocialSecurityCuts

Fred Korematsu challenged an Executive Order that forcefully interned hundreds of thousands of Japanese Americans during WWII. On #KorematsuDay we commemorate his contributions to ensuring Americans' civil liberties and his tireless work against injustice in our nation.

Any senator who validates these outrageous claims is paving the way for a government that operates outside the bounds of its own laws, giving unrestrained power to lawmakers with no mechanism to hold them accountable. Is that what we want as a nation?

Acquitting this president will open a floodgate of foreign interference in our elections justified by using this same argument. This assertion could also be used to defend other wrongful acts by lawmakers & candidates, rendering them impervious to consequences for their misdeeds.

The president's lawyers have argued that his office affords him unprecedented power and by extension, anyone running for office cannot be held accountable for breaking the law if it’s in an effort to get elected.

During the recent wildfires, 88 cell towers went down in @CCCounty, cutting people off from emergency services & loved ones. I asked @AjitPaiFCC to hold a field hearing in Northern California on this issue & today I'm following up on his commitment to me.
The balance of power in our nation is derived from our Constitution. Anyone who votes to leave this president in office will be an accomplice to the collapse of our country’s very foundation.

Thanks to everyone who came out to my Stockton and Antioch open house events! Your thoughts and concerns are important to me, and these events are a great opportunity for me to hear directly from you about the critical issues facing our community and our nation.
If you’re in the Antioch area, I hope you can make it to my Antioch office for my open house tonight!

Veterans with traumatic brain injuries (TBIs) can have constant pain & reduced cognitive function. I wrote the law to improve care for service members with TBIs & am disgusted the president would trivialize these severe injuries. Our troops deserve better.

This sham trial proves that the GOP is officially the party of Trump. Both House and Senate Republicans have shown that they are governed by the fear of crossing their leader, rather than the oath they swore to uphold. This is a sad statement about the future of our democracy.

Looking forward to seeing everyone at my open house in Stockton tonight! Stop by my office between 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM for an update on what's happening in Washington and a discussion about the important issues impacting our nation.

This year marks the 25th anniversary of the day of service that honors Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. As we celebrate his life and the contributions he made to our nation, I hope you’ll join me in recommitting to finding ways to best serve our own community. https://www.nationalservice.gov/serve-your-community/mlk-day-service
Next Thursday, January 23rd, I'll be hosting an open house event at my Antioch office from 6:00-7:30 PM. I'm looking forward to hearing from you about the issues that are important to our community!
I'll be hosting the an open house event at my Stockton office next Wednesday, January 22nd from 6:00-7:30 PM. Hope to see you there!
The #climatecrisis is the greatest threat of our time. We need bold action, and that’s why I’m proud to join my E&C colleagues to announce our #CLEANfuture proposal.

One year ago today, the House introduced #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act of 2019. We passed this legislation shortly after, but @senatemajldr refuses to bring this crucial bill to the Senate floor. RT to tell him it’s time to vote to #EndGunViolence.

Our founding fathers created a system of checks and balances to ensure this kind of reckless behavior could be stopped by a co-equal branch of government. We cannot allow the sole power in the executive to force our nation into another senseless war.
But once again this president has acted without any thought for a long-term national security strategy, and put more Americans’ lives in danger.
None of us will shed a tear for Qasem Suleimani - he was a murderer, responsible for the deaths of hundreds of American troops and thousands of innocent civilians.

With no congressional approval or consultation, the president launched targeted airstrikes and has now ordered thousands more soldiers to a region of the world that he promised to withdraw American troops from.
I'm getting ready to speak on the House floor in support of the articles of impeachment. You can can follow along with the debate below.

If the president's actions bare no consequence, future presidents may act without constraint and American democracy will be at an end. Therefore, I will uphold my sworn duty to defend the Constitution and vote to impeach this president.

California's open enrollment period to sign-up for health insurance continues until January 31st. Those who sign-up by December 15th will be covered starting the first of the year. For more information, visit Covered California's website:

Today I cast my vote for Marta and the millions of others struggling with the skyrocketing price of prescription medication. Passing H.R. 3 is the first step to #LowerDrugCosts for the American people.

Coastal communities are already suffering from a rise in sea levels, increased flooding, & severe weather due to #ClimateChange. @HouseDemocrats just passed bipartisan #OceanClimateAction bills to protect the 42% of Americans living in these areas.

Today marks two years since @POTUS and @FCC repealed #NetNeutrality rules. We passed the #SaveTheInternet Act in the House earlier this year, and I’m joining @SenateDems in demanding an immediate vote on this bill in the Senate!
There is nothing more sacred in our democracy than the right to vote. That’s why @HouseDemocrats passed #HR4 to put an end to egregious voter suppression tactics and #RestoreTheVote #ForThePeople.

Because of Trump’s #FamilySeparation policy: Thousands of families have been torn apart Parents have been deported without their children The Admin has yet to reunify all separated families #DontLookAway - watch the panel on #USCCRReports https://www.facebook.com/congressional.hispanic.caucus/
Thanks to all the volunteers who came out to help serve our community!
Wishing you and yours a very happy Thanksgiving!

SNAP is the first line of defense against hunger and food insecurity those in need. But this administration wants to cut this crucial program, risking the health of our most vulnerable population: our children. #1MillionKids

Across the country, many family members take on the role of caregiver for loved ones in need. We can all support these selfless individuals this #NationalFamilyCaregiversMonth with simple acts of kindness, such as sending a card, helping them run an errand, or preparing a meal.

A persistent gender-based wage gap continues to harm women, their families, and the economy – and it is particularly damaging for Latinas. We must #DemandMore and pass the #PaycheckFairness Act now. #LatinaEqualPay
I had a great time this weekend at the NAACP Stockton Branch Freedom Fund Banquet. It was an honor to help recognize the six awardees for their contributions and service to our community.
Our children shouldn't have to go to school in fear. The House has passed multiple commonsense gun safety bills, and it's past time for the Senate to act. #EnoughIsEnough

2019 marks the 100th anniversary of Congressional passage of the 19th Amendment affirming women’s right to vote. But women's rights are still not guaranteed in the Constitution. That’s why I’m proud to cosponsor the Equal Rights Amendment. #ERANow! #ERAHearing

#DACA recipients are integral members of our communities. They've built their lives here and should have the opportunity to continue contributing to our communities without the constant threat of deportation. For DACA recipients #HomeisHere, and I am proud to stand with them.

Over 4 million Californians have diabetes & struggle with medical costs that are approximately 2.3x higher than those without. Last year, @CDCgov provided more than $6 million for prevention & education programs, & I'll continue to support this critical funding. #CountMeInADA

This administration wants to allow widespread discrimination in our health care system, jeopardizing many Americans' care – including women & the LGBTQ community. We can’t allow this. That’s why I’m proud to cosponsor the #PutPatientsFirst Act to stop this harmful rule.

It was a privilege to attend today’s #VeteransDay Ceremony in Antioch and to recognize this year’s Antioch Veteran of the Year, Mr. Denny Hollison. Thank you to all of our nation’s veterans for their service and their sacrifice.

President Trump is intentionally and willfully condemning future generations to a world of catastrophic climate change and conflict. Our withdrawal from the Paris Climate Accord will abandon America's leadership at a time when the world needs it most.
It was a privilege to sit down with Ivan, a Stocktonian and @NALC_National Local Hero Award winner, who courageously helped a young girl escape a dangerous and horrible situation.

Diwali celebrates the inner light that protects us during the darkest times. I want to thank the Mountain House Sikh community for inviting me to the join them during the Diwali Mela Festival of Lights.
#VaccinesWork to save children’s lives from deadly diseases. Over 400 million children are vaccinated each year to #EndPolio, and we are closer than ever to eradicating this disease. #WorldPolioDay

Great turn-out at the Stockton Walk to End Alzheimer’s this past weekend! Over the last five years, Congress has quadrupled Alzheimer’s research funding, but we still have more work to do. I’ll continue to support and push for federal investment in research until we find a cure.
Thanks to the students from McCaffrey Middle School who stopped by the Capitol today! It was great to hear from such bright and inquisitive young people.

Federal investment in neuroscience research is crucial to medical discovery. As @SfNtweets holds its annual meeting, I will continue to push for much-needed funding to advance our understanding of the brain and the nervous system, and to combat neurodegenerative illnesses.
The cost of prescription medication is skyrocketing and Americans demand that Congress take action. H.R. 3 would give Medicare the authority to negotiate #LowerDrugCosts for the American people.
Open enrollment has begun. Californians can sign-up for health insurance coverage from now until January 31st by visiting the Covered California website.

The Outsourcing Accountability Act will bring real transparency at a time when consumers are becoming increasingly conscious about where they spend and invest their money. We deserve to know if companies are exploiting these practices at the expense of American workers.
My thoughts are with his family and the people of his district, whom he so loved.

His faith led him to a life of public service, and his stalwart belief in equality and democracy fueled his pursuit for truth and justice. To many of us, Elijah was the moral compass for this hallowed chamber.
He was a man of principle, who led by example – always expounding on our shared humanity rather than exploiting our differences, cultivating friendships on both sides of the aisle.

Today, our country mourns the loss of a great champion of truth, and my colleagues and I mourn the loss of a dear friend. Elijah Cummings came to Congress to represent his community in Baltimore, and throughout his tenure he represented much more.
My statement on the D.C. Circuit Court's #NetNeutrality decision:
Thank you for your leadership in the Senate!

Congress must act to ensure Americans’ safety. PFAS are dangerous chemicals found in drinking water throughout the country. I was proud to stand with my colleagues today to support congressional action to address this pressing issue.
Yesterday, @repbenraylujan, @RepYvetteClarke and I introduced the Digital Equity Act – a critical piece of legislation to close gaps in broadband adoption and digital literacy. #digitalequitynow

Our oceans absorb 1/3 of CO2 emissions and 90% of heat from #ClimateChange. But right now they’re under extreme stress, resulting in increased warming and ocean acidity. Today @NRDems vote on 10 #OceanClimateAction bills. We must protect our oceans to save our planet.
To fulfill our sworn duty, Congress must move forward with an impeachment inquiry. Brazen lies have been a hallmark of this presidency and it is now time for a reckoning. 2/2

When I came to Washington, I swore an oath to uphold the Constitution and I do not take that responsibility lightly. The allegations against the president are grave, and they are a threat to our democracy and national security. 1/2
Excited to join my colleague @HurdOnTheHill for this important conversation on #AI and military readiness. #TheAtlanticFest

Americans and people around the world expect the United States to lead on critical issues, but time is running out. We need a bold agenda to combat #climatechange, and that starts with the passage of H.R. 9, the #ClimateActionNow Act.
Under the Trump Administration, @EPAAWheeler apparently gets to decide what is and is not a science issue, and overrule an entire board of actual scientists.

Clean water is a fundamental human right. The #DirtyWaterRule is an unprecedented attack on the health and safety of all Americans, putting the water sources for tens of millions of people at risk. We must put #PeopleBeforePolluters and #ProtectOurWater.
Excited to join @POLITICOLive for an important discussion on AI. #POLITICOAI

With a former coal lobbyist at the helm, the EPA has been reduced to a shell of what it once was as President Trump continues to ram through a big-business agenda that will ultimately make our water less safe for use and consumption.
Thanks to @TheBridgeWork for the opportunity to discuss what I'm working on in Congress & as co-chair of the AI Caucus. Check out the full profile here:

By following this deliberative process, the Judiciary Committee’s inquiry will be a transparent and thorough examination of current evidence. These proceedings will answer questions that are critical to determining if impeachment is necessary. 2/2
I support Chairman Nadler’s decision to open a formal impeachment inquiry. Americans deserve to know the truth, and many are gravely concerned by the president’s dubious actions. 1/2
Hispanic Americans make our communities more vibrant and prosperous. Happy #HispanicHeritageMonth to all those celebrating in my district and across the country!

Dreamers, TPS & DED recipients are important members of our communities in California & across the country. I was happy to meet with @carecensf and representatives from my district to discuss permanent protections for these groups and their families.

Last Congress, Republicans opened 19 million acres of federally protected, untouched Alaska wilderness to big oil. Opening the Arctic Refuge would destroy one of the last unspoiled places on Earth. This is no place for drilling & today I was proud to vote to #ProtectTheArctic.

Thanks to representatives from @AmericanCancer for stopping by my office to discuss their legislative priorities. I’ve long supported federal investments in research and I’ll continue to advocate for the critical funding needed in the continued search for a cure.

President Trump wants to open our coasts to more oil & gas drilling, but coastal drilling destroys beaches, businesses and communities' way of life. That’s why I voted for @RepCunningham's bill to #ProtectOurCoast.

Over 70% of Americans support banning high-capacity magazines, which are too often used in mass shootings. Gun violence is an epidemic, but we can make our communities safer with rational legislative action. That’s why I’m proud to cosponsor the #KeepAmericansSafeAct.

Many of us remember exactly where we were #WhenTheWorldStopped 18 years ago. Today we honor the memory of those lost and pay tribute to the heroes who risked their own lives to save others. We must #NeverForget.
A study by the @IPS_DC found that the average Black family would need 228 years to obtain the wealth of a White family in the 21st Century. #400YearsLater

#400YearsLater, the Transatlantic Slave Trade is still the largest coerced migration of human beings in the world's history. Slavery officially lasted in the US for 246 years, & the psychological & economic toll has consequences to this day. 1/2

I recently had the privilege of presenting Mr. Robert Welker with the National Defense Service Medal and the Vietnam Service Medal. It was an honor to thank Mr. Welker, who is a Navy veteran, for his service during the Vietnam War and his service to our country.

Thousands of #Dreamers in my district & across the country need permanent protection from deportation. While the Trump administration threatens their legal status, forcing them to live in fear, @TheDemocrats are working to #ProtectTheDream for all #DACA, #TPS & #DED recipients.

Great turnout at last week’s town halls! Many of you came with important questions about some of our nation’s most pressing issues, and we had a very informative discussion about how to move our country forward.
I hope you can join me for a town hall in Stockton on Friday, August 30th from 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM at Cesar Chavez High School.

While the President is playing political games and backpedaling on his commitments, gun violence continues to devastate communities across our nation. It’s been 175 days since the House passed the bipartisan #HR8 and commonsense #HR1112. The Senate must #DoSomething.
I hope you can join me for a joint town hall with my colleague @RepDeSaulnier on Thursday, August 29th, from 6:30 PM to 8:00 PM at the Antioch Community Center.

For 7 years, #DACA has successfully protected 800K young people from deportation. These #Dreamers are our neighbors, family, & friends. But the Trump administration is threatening their future in the U.S. That's why @HouseDemocrats are continuing to fight to #ProtectTheDream.

1 in 7 Californians relies on social security. As we celebrate 84 years of this critical program, let us recommit to ensuring its longevity and expanding it to meet Americans' changing needs. #SocSec84
I had a great time meeting with the men and women undertaking the critical work at our National Labs!

In my district, the Delta is home to many endangered and protected species. This ecosystem and our local economy depend on their survival, yet once again the president is choosing the interests of industry over the interests of the American public.

Right now, @senatemajldr is blocking the progress of two practical pieces of legislation that would enhance our background check system. #EnoughIsEnough. He & other Republicans who are in the pocket of the NRA must answer: Whose side are you on?

Americans are sick & tired of the demands & desires of special interest coming before their needs. We need a constitutional amendment to end the culture of corruption that is fueled by our #campaignfinance system. That's why my proposal would eliminate PACs & ban #darkmoney.

As National Parks & Rec Month comes to an end, I hope you’ll join me in thanking our own California Parks Department for taking care of the most diverse collection of natural, cultural, and recreational resources in our state. #GameOnJuly

Across the nation, communities regularly face the tragedy of gun violence. This is an epidemic that can only be curbed by bold actions, but we must all share in the political will to advance reforms. For the sake of all Americans, we can & must do better.

Today, the House passed the #StopBadRobocalls Act – which includes an amendment that I offered to increase penalties against the most egregious violators of the law. This commonsense legislation is critical for protecting consumers and putting an end to these abusive practices.

Over a million Americans are at risk of losing their pensions if the House fails to pass the #ButchLewisAct - putting their families’ financial security and future at risk. No one should live in fear that their hard-earned retirement savings will collapse.

Today, the House votes to #PassthePASTAct, which would end the inhumane practice of soring #horses by intentionally inflicting pain to their feet in order to win prizes. I'm proud to cosponsor H.R. 693 & call on the Senate to swiftly pass this bill & end this senseless cruelty.
Achieving net zero carbon pollution by 2050 is necessary to protect the climate, public health and our economy. Combating this crisis is still possible, but only if we #ActOnClimate now. #100by50
Today, we witnessed Robert Mueller testify under oath that his report does NOT exonerate the President. #MuellerHearings

I’m excited to join @POLITICOLive for a discussion about #AI and the federal government. Tune in here to follow along: https://www.politico.com/live-stream/unlocking-the-ai-data-puzzle-in-federal-government

Today @EnergyCommerce passed the #StopBadRobocalls Act – a crucial step to put consumers back in control of their phones. I’m proud to cosponsor this bill, which includes an amendment I offered with @RepBillFlores to increase penalties for the most egregious violators of the law.

Science is under attack. This administration has prohibited federal scientists from speaking about climate change, & climate data has been scrubbed from many gov't websites. We must protect their work to safeguard public health & our environment. #ScienceNotSilence #ForThePeople

#OTD in 1969, #Apollo11 sent three astronauts on a trajectory to the moon. Today we celebrate this achievement and recognize that our unique American spirit has always given us the courage to dream big and the resiliency to follow through. #Apollo50th
This president has shown himself over and over to be a racist. These attacks have only unified Democrats and reminded the American people why they decided to change the makeup of Congress in 2018.
#ICEraids are expected to take place this weekend in cities across the country. Make sure you #KnowYourRights.

Secretary Acosta is defending an indefensible decision that protected a predator and robbed his victims of a chance for justice. Americans have no confidence in his ability to head the department charged with fighting human trafficking. He should resign immediately.

Due to the the multi-employer pension crisis, 1.5 MILLION retirees, workers & their families are set to lose benefits they earned throughout a lifetime of hard work. By advancing the #ButchLewisAct, @WaysMeansCmte will ensure all retirees are guaranteed the benefits they deserve.
Congratulations! #USWMNT
Wishing everyone a safe and happy 4th of July! Happy #IndependenceDay!

The #SCOTUS #gerrymandering decision highlights the need for Congress to take action. Last week, I secured funding in one of the House spending packages for @NSF to study & establish science-based best practices for congressional redistricting so we can ensure a fair process.

The spreading of political disinformation on social media poses grave consequences to our nation’s democracy. That’s why my @EnergyCommerce colleagues & I sent a letter to Mark Zuckerberg with questions about @facebook's handling of the doctored video of Speaker Pelosi.
Two amendments that I introduced were included in yesterday's spending package that passed on the House floor. #CBD #Gerrymandering

Six years ago, SCOTUS gutted the Voting Rights Act in the Shelby County v. Holder decision. Millions of Americans were left vulnerable to racial discrimination & voter disenfranchisement, unraveling the legacy of this momentous legislation. We must #RestoreTheVote & pass #HR4.

Small businesses are the backbone of our economy, creating jobs and driving innovation. H.R.3351 makes substantial investments in resources for entrepreneurs & small businesses – like the 30,000 in my district – by providing access to training & materials to help them succeed.

We must renew our commitment to protecting the air we breathe, the water we drink, and the planet we all call home. That’s why I support the FY20 Interior-Environment bill, which includes $37.3 billion to protect the environment, ensure clean air & water, & preserve wildlife.

I introduced two amendments that passed on the House floor this week. One directs the FDA to set safe consumption levels for #CBD products, and the other tackles the widespread problem of #gerrymandering.

With a recorded 70.8 million displaced people fleeing violence & persecution around the world, there is still much work to do. That’s why I'm proud to join my colleagues in recognizing #WorldRefugeeDay by cosponsoring H.Res. 444 to reaffirm U.S. commitment to protecting refugees.

Millions of women, #LGBTQ Americans, and people of color rely on the Affordable Care Act, but the Trump administration is threatening their health by trying to roll back critical protections. We need to #PutPatientsFirst and keep discrimination out of our healthcare.

@HouseDemocrats are pushing forward funding legislation #ForThePeople. That why the FY2020 Commerce-Justice-Science bill provides $74 billion to promote civil rights, reduce gun violence, combat climate change, & address many other issues that are important to Americans.

Today, my colleagues & I sent a letter to @AjitPaiFCC urging him to move forward with taking a fresh look at the 5.9 GHz band. It’s time we re-examine how this band is being used & how to allocate it in a way that meets the demands of our times & best serves the American people.

The Trump administration is moving forward with their #DirtyPowerScam – gutting the #CleanPowerPlan & rolling back the progress we’ve made on climate change solutions. @EPAAWheeler is once again putting polluter profits over Americans’ best interests.
Thank you, my friend! And a big thanks to all for the warm birthday wishes.

Today marks the longest period in U.S. history without an increase to the federal minimum wage since it's establishment in 1938. No one working full-time in this country should be living in poverty. It's time to #RaiseTheWage.
Hate has no place here. As we celebrate #Pride, let us recognize the important history of the #LGBT community and that we still have more to do to make our nation a fairer, more just country.
Whether he doesn’t understand the law or doesn’t care about it, the president’s indifference on election interference is a threat to our democracy and to our very way of life.

Once again, President Trump is using his media platform to make lawless activity seem normal. But the American people understand that any foreign entity offering campaign information has ulterior motives.
I’m looking forward to continuing to work together on this important issue.

As co-chair of the Congressional #AICaucus, I was excited to host a roundtable conversation today with leading experts from @StanfordHAI. Thanks to @drfeifei, Dr. John Etchemendy & @MPSellitto for an engaging discussion about their work at the Institute & emerging trends in #AI.

More than 5,000 people are diagnosed with ALS every year. I’ve long supported federal funding for ALS research and will continue to do so until a cure is found. Thanks to @alsassociation for meeting with me to discuss how Congress can continue to support #ALSAdvocacy.

#PublicCharge is a rule that would allow the Trump administration to restrict green cards based on income, health, English proficiency, age & use of public programs. This proposal is another cruel attack on #immigrant communities.

For the first time in more than 20 years, we have an appropriations package that includes funding for @CDCgov & @NIH to conduct gun violence prevention research. I'm proud to stand with my @HouseDemocrats colleagues in the fight for a safer America #ForThePeople.

Nearly 30 MILLION Americans are living without health insurance, and another 40 million cannot afford their co-pays or deductibles. We can do better. Today’s @WaysmeansCmte hearing on universal coverage is a step toward making #MedicareforAll a reality.

Congratulations to this year’s Military Academy appointees! These six exemplary students from California’s 9th Congressional District are going on to attend the Military Academy, Naval Academy and Air Force Academy.

It’s been more than 2 months since the House passed the #SaveTheNet Act, and Americans across the political spectrum agree that we need to restore #NetNeutrality rules. But today @SenateMajLdr blocked a vote on it in the Senate, burying it in his legislative graveyard.

On one of the darkest days in our nation’s history, our 9/11 first responders risked everything to help their fellow Americans. With the 9/11 Victim Compensation Fund set to expire, we cannot turn our backs on these heroes. #Renew911VCF
As we celebrate #ImmigrantHeritageMonth, the House passage of the Dream & Promise Act is a reminder that much our nation’s success is due to our commitment to welcoming new communities. #HR6
Great conversations yesterday at our 3rd #ScienceOnTheHill event! Thanks to all those who attended and participated!
On the 75th Anniversary of D-Day, we remember the bravery and sacrifice of all those who fought at Normandy and honor their legacy. #DDAY75

This #WorldEnvironmentDay, we're reminded that we should listen to scientists and experts about the urgent need to combat #climatechange, instead of someone who goes around saying things like “we have the cleanest climates.” That’s… not how this works.

100 days ago, the House passed #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act. Today, my colleagues and I called on @senatemajldr to bring this commonsense legislation to the Senate floor for a vote because #EnoughIsEnough. #EndGunViolence

More than 90% of excess heat & about 1/3 of carbon dioxide in our atmosphere is absorbed by the ocean. As we continue to take #ClimateActionNow, we must also #ProtectOurOceans. That’s why I’m proud to support critical legislation essential to the preservation of our oceans.

Today we heard from many #FosterYouthVoices about their personal experiences & how we can improve our child welfare system. I had the privilege of hosting a young woman named Erica, who has become an advocate on this issue & many other issues affecting young people in America.

Over 415k children are living in foster care in the U.S. Tomorrow, I'll be participating in #FosterYouthShadowDay as foster youth from across the country will meet with Members of Congress to talk about how government can improve our child welfare system. #FosterYouthVoices

Two years ago today, the president decided to pull out of the Paris Climate Agreement and put the future of nation’s economy and public health at risk. I voted for the #ClimateActionNow Act, which blocks Trump from removing us. America can either lead or be left behind.
Congratulations to the 8th graders of Hazelton Elementary! I’m never more optimistic about our nation’s future than when I’m surrounded by bright young people who will lead the next generation.
Looking forward to a great discussion next week! Hope you can join us!

On #MemorialDay, we pay tribute to the brave men and women who gave the ultimate sacrifice to protect our country and all that we stand for. Thank you to our nation’s heroes and their families, who also sacrifice so much so that their loved ones can serve.

Since abandoning the Iran Deal, the U.S. has forfeited its position of diplomatic strength in pursuit of a reckless ideology. The President is now escalating his aggression by deploying 1,500 additional soldiers to the Middle East, which may provoke a wider conflict.

I recently introduced bipartisan legislation to put the federal government on a path to harness the full potential of AI in a responsible way – one that will enhance government’s ability to fulfill its mission, create new economic opportunities & reduce potential harmful effects.

We exist because of the diverse array of living organisms all around us. But because of humans, 1 million species are in danger of extinction. If we don’t #ActOnClimate & #StopExtinction, we could lose the animals & plants that make Earth livable. #InternationalBiodiversityDay

To mitigate and combat the threats of #climatechange, our nation must #ActOnClimate now and invest in a clean energy future for all Americans. That’s why I’m proud to support the #LIFTAmerica Act, which would fund the installation of solar panels in underserved communities.

Yesterday’s Grid Innovation and Infrastructure Expo featured cutting edge technologies that are paving the way for a cleaner, modernized power grid. Thanks to my co-hosts @boblatta, @Edison_Electric, @NEMAupdates and @gridwisedc.

100 years ago, the House of Representatives passed the 19th Amendment. Today, we’re celebrating this milestone in our nation’s history by wearing a yellow rose in honor of those who fought to give women a voice in our government. #WomensVote100
Mr. President, stop provoking and start talking. Use all diplomatic channels to ease tensions with Iran.

I can’t imagine what it was like to be the first to see that groundbreaking image of a black hole – and to know your work contributed to this achievement – but I think Dr. Katie Bouman sums it up perfectly. #WomenInSTEM

We cannot claim to be the land of the free until all our citizens have equal protection under the law. For many #LGBTQ Americans that is not the reality. But today @HouseDemocrats have said no more by passing #HR5 because fairness & equality are our nation's core values.

Thanks to Dr. Katie Bouman and members of the @ehtelescope team for testifying before @HouseScience about their groundbreaking work capturing the first image of a black hole, and about the importance of continued investment in scientific advancement.

Millions of Americans who rely on prescription drugs are depending on Congress to ensure their medications are affordable. This week, the House is taking action #ForThePeople and voting on critical legislation to lower drug costs and #ProtectOurCare.

By escalating tensions with Iran, this administration sends us closer to another senseless war without any Congressional input or our Constitutionally-required authorization for use of military force. After decades of endless war, the American people have had enough. #NoIranWar

In 2019, 25 million Americans in rural communities still lack access to affordable high-speed internet. Closing the digital divide means increased job and educational opportunities for those Americans. #RuralBroadband

On this day, let’s honor the special women in our lives who have guided us and made a positive impact on us. Today, I’ll be celebrating with my wife Mary, whose love, kindness and strength has been the bedrock of our family. Happy #MothersDay to all those celebrating today.

This week, the administration announced it will be increasing our military presence in Iranian territory. By doing so, President Trump is intensifying tensions with Iran, and putting our troops in danger with his aggressive tactics.

The Trump Administration is trying to take us back to a time when it was legal to discriminate against Americans with pre-existing conditions. But we won't let that happen. That’s why I'm voting for the Protecting Americans with Preexisting Conditions Act. #ProtectOurCare

Great to have @SJCOG in Washington today! I’m committed to fighting for critical infrastructure investments and essential transportation funding for our area, and I look forward to continuing to work with these dedicated community leaders to strengthen our region.

Small businesses are the backbone of our economy - they create two out of every three new jobs each year. This #NationalSmallBusinessWeek and every week, I’m proud to honor our hardworking small business men and women, and to champion the small businesses in my district.
Instead, he would rather split hairs over the honesty of his answers and forego answering anymore questions all together.

His answers before the Senate Judiciary Committee and his failure to appear before the House Judiciary Committee confirm that he is not committed to the job he is charged with: upholding our constitution.
This week, Attorney General Barr proved that he is working to protect the president, and not working on behalf of the American people.

As a long-time opponent of the wasteful and ill-conceived #DeltaTunnels, I’m looking forward to working with @GavinNewsom and others on a comprehensive approach to a sustainable water future for California.

Today the House passed H.R. 9, the #ClimateActionNow Act. The U.S. has always led by example. That's why it's imperative that we rejoin the Paris Climate Accord. If we retreat, we are condemning future generations to a world filled with catastrophic #climatechange and conflict.
The President’s decision to withdraw from the Paris Agreement puts the future of our environment, economy, and health at risk. It’s time to say “We are still in.” #ClimateActionNow

Thanks to everyone who came out to my Antioch open house! As I head back to Washington, I’m re-energized after hearing your stories, ideas and concerns, and I’m looking forward to continuing to work on your behalf.

Hope to see you on Friday at my open house! Please stop by my Antioch office anytime between 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM to hear what's going on in Washington and to share your views on issues important to you and our community.

My thoughts go out to those affected by last night's fire — especially the brave firefighter who was injured while working to extinguish the blaze. Thank you to all of our first responders who routinely put the safety of our community before their own.
Thanks to everyone who came out to my Stockton open house! I’m looking forward to catching up with more folks at my Antioch open house next week!
It was great to see so many people that care about our environment, science, and the importance of “moving green” out today at the Stockton Earth Day Festival!
I hope you’ll join me in wishing our Sikh American neighbors and friends a very happy #Vaisakhi!

This week in the world of science, two groundbreaking advances made the headlines. From the first image of a black hole to the discovery of a new human relative, this was only possible because of humanity’s innate drive to know more.

Because of the hard work of some extraordinary scientists we are able to witness something that is truly amazing: the first picture of a black hole. We need to think about this as something bigger than ourselves. https://www.sciencenews.org/article/black-hole-first-picture-event-horizon-telescope

The first 100 days of the 116th Congress have been focused on protecting the rights of voters, fighting #climatechange, ensuring LGBTQ rights, and protecting dreamers. I look forward to the work that will continue to be done throughout this Congress. #100DaysForThePeople
You called, wrote letters, attended town halls and made your voices heard. Today is a victory for free speech, democracy and above all the American people. #SaveTheNet

The House of Representatives just passed the #SavetheNet Act! I’m proud to be an original cosponsor of this critical legislation that will restore strong #netneutrality protections for my constituents and all Americans.

The #SaveTheNet Act takes an approach that accounts for the internet of today and of tomorrow, and it provides certainty for Americans across the country. I'm proud to be an original cosponsor of this critical legislation, and I'll continue to fight to restore #NetNeutrality.
My @reddit AMA on #netneutrality and the Save the Internet Act will start at 8 PM EST, but you can submit your questions now. I'm looking forward to a great discussion! #SaveTheNet
I'll be hosting a @Reddit AMA on #NetNeutrality tonight from 8 to 9 PM EST. Hope you can join me! #SaveTheNet

If you're in the Antioch area, I hope you can stop by my open house on April 26th. I'll be hosting it at my Antioch office from 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM, and I'm looking forward to having some great discussions about the issues that are most important to you.

As a former wind energy engineer, I can tell you the president's recent claims are blatantly false. Wind is one of the lowest-priced sources of energy, and unlike fossil fuels, it produces no harmful emissions that contribute to #climatechange.
Today is World Autism Day – a day to promote understanding and acceptance of people with autism and their unique strengths and challenges. #Congress4LIUB

#EqualPay is not just an issue for women. It impacts families, businesses and our economy. The House has passed the #PaycheckFairnessAct to ensure equal pay for equal work, and now it’s the Senate’s turn.

Unsafe levels of contamination in drinking water disproportionately affects vulnerable communities. The president’s #DirtyWaterRule will put the health of Americans across the country at further risk. Safe drinking water is a human right, & we must #ProtectCleanWater for all.

Trump’s #DirtyWaterRule will put the drinking water sources for tens of millions of people at risk, as well as the wetlands that communities rely on for flood protection. It's time to #ProtectCleanWater.
I'll be hosting an open house at my Stockton office on Thursday, April 18th from 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM EST. I hope to see you there!

This week, @HouseDemocrats introduced two major pieces of legislation to preserve protections for people with pre-existing conditions and to recommit the U.S. to leading the fight against #climatechange.
On #VietnamVeteransDay, we commemorate the withdrawal of U.S. combat and combat support units from South Vietnam in 1973. We thank all those who served and honor those who did not return home.

Thanks to the representatives from @CalStateEastBay who stopped by my DC office. I’ve long fought to expand access to higher education and I’ll continue to defend crucial federal funding - especially Pell Grants, which enable countless students to continue their education.

Today in #SubCommTech we took a critical step in the fight to restore #netneutrality by advancing #SavetheNet to the full @EnergyCommerce. This important piece of legislation would reestablish vital net neutrality protections to ensure a free and open internet #ForThePeople.

#Netneutrality fuels competition & innovation in our economy, enables the internet to be an equalizer & is essential for our democracy. The #SaveTheNet Act is a simple & straightforward bill that would restore net neutrality protections, & I’m proud to be an original cosponsor.
Earlier this week I joined Mike Burkholder to talk about some of issues I’m working on and what’s happening in Washington. Check out the link for the the full interview.
Great turn out at yesterday’s Veterans Town Hall! Thank you to everyone who came and participated in the informative discussion.

I am cosponsoring the #SaveTheNet Act to restore critical #NetNeutrality protections. These protections are the core of a free and open internet, and ensure consumers – not corporations – are in control.

I had the opportunity to meet with Oakley Mayor Claire Alaura to discuss how we can work together on important issues in our community - including transportation and public safety. At the end of our meeting, I was honored when she presented me with the key to the city.

As a mathematician, #PiDay holds a special place in my heart. While you enjoy your sweet treat today, it’s also the perfect occasion to reflect on the importance of science and mathematics in our lives.

Restoring #NetNeutrality is one of most important digital rights issues today. The #SaveTheNet Act gives the power back to the people, stops abusive corporate practices, and fosters innovation and competition.

The Delta is the lifeblood of our community – that’s why I proudly cosponsored legislation to designate the Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta as California’s first National Heritage Area. Today is a great victory for the Delta region as that legislation has been signed into law.

When the @FCC moved to repeal #netneutrality, more than 8,000 of my constituents reached out to my office to express their concerns. The #SaveTheNet Act will restore these crucial protections, and I’m proud to be an original cosponsor of this important legislation.

Today was a good day in Washington because the House passed the #ForThePeople Act. I’m proud to be on the right side of history as a cosponsor of this important legislation, which would put our government back in the hands of the American people.

This #InternationalWomensDay, I'm proud to celebrate the record number of women I have the privilege of serving alongside in Congress. Today and everyday, let us recommit ourselves to the fight for equality.

Today, Port of Stockton Director Richard Aschieris & I discussed the Port’s future & its contributions to our community. It is the 4th busiest port in California & employs over 10,000 people. As a member of the Congressional Ports Caucus, I’ll continue to fight for its success.

As a co-chair of the Bipartisan #CampaignFinance Reform Caucus, I am committed to fixing our broken system & ending the undue influence of money in our elections. The #ForThePeople Act is a vital step toward restoring the voice of the voters & I’m proud to be a cosponsor.

I'm excited to announce the 2019 Congressional Art Competition! If you're a high school student or know a high school student in the 9th Congressional District who has a passion for art, check out my website for more information on how to participate: https://mcnerney.house.gov/services/2019-congressional-art-competition

I’ve heard from thousands of my constituents, and I’ve stood with Americans across the nation in the fight to restore #NetNeutrality. Today my colleagues and I are proud to introduce legislation to #SaveTheNet.
San Joaquin RTD is an award-winning innovator in meeting the transportation needs of our community. I was honored to join them for the grand opening of the Union Transfer Station.
